item.title: Windows 9 is coming everyone
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
ME was some mutant child of an attempt at taking ms-dos support out of Windows 98 and add some features from Windows NT but in the end it was just a shitty, unstable, buggy piece of shit OS.

Windows 2000 was a real update to Windows NT and then XP was the definitive home version of 2000.

Windows 98/ME were the last Windows with real MS-DOS support and from 2000 forwards, all Windows versions are based on NT.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 9 is coming everyone
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
I’d say Windows 8.1 kind of is recommendable but if you still have 7 just wait and see what 9 brings to the table.

With 8.1 you can skip the Modern UI altogether and it actually feels like the natural evolution of 7 in some respects, but if 9 brings back some of the nice stuff from 7 while building upon the proper improvements from 8, I’ll probably upgrade in a heartbeat, although MS will most likely find a way to ruin it somehow.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 9 is coming everyone
item.dc:creator: Lemonz_amp_amp_orang
item.description:
they better add an option to use the age-old, legacy desktop format, and i expect an improvement from from windows xp or 7 in that realm

as long as i dont have to have that tablet UI forced down my throat (i may try it out from time to time, but nothing will keep me from my legacy desktop), i will make a switch from 7

item.title: Windows 9 is coming everyone

item.description:
Judging by the pattern, this is supposed to be the good one, right? :retard:
In all seriousness, it sounds like they at least understand some of why 8 wasn’t as well-received as they would have hoped. Hopefully they’ll be doing something about it.
